name: Religion for the Worldly Trivia Game | Religion Mixture | 5 Questions

questions.text: The world headquarters of the Bahá'í religion is located in what eastern Mediterranean country?
questions.explanation:
Israel.

	The Bahá'í religion is headquartered in Haifa, Israel.  An offshoot of Islam, it is a unifying faith welcoming the teachings of prophets from several world religions.

questions.text: Which Asian religion employs the inactive philosophy of 'wu-wei'?
questions.explanation:
Taoism.

	'Wu-wei' literally means 'not doing'.  The philosophy of Taoism centers on receding from worldly affairs and returning to nature.  Taoism was formulated as a philosophy and religious movement several millennia back in China.

questions.text: Zoroastrianism is an ancient religion that has all but disappeared.  However, practioners of this faith may still be found in some cities of India.  What are these modern Zoroastrians called?
questions.explanation:
Parsees.

	There are several hundred thousand Parsees in the world, still faithful to the religion originated in Persia.  The founder of Zoroastrianism was a man named Zoroaster, also called Zarathustra.  His holy book was called the 'Zend-Avesta'.

questions.text: What three animals represents the 'Three Poisons' of Buddhism?
questions.explanation:
snake, cock, pig.

	Desire is represented by the cock, hatred by the snake, and ignorance by the pig.  Hence, these animals are to be avoided, they are 'evil' creatures.

questions.text: Who was the founder of the Jewish Zionist movement in 1897?
questions.explanation:
Herzl.

	Theodor Herzl was an Austrian writer whose lifelong goal was to found a Jewish homeland, which would be called 'Israel'.  He never saw his dream fulfilled, but it finally was in 1948 with the establishment of the nation of Israel.  Thank you for trying this quiz, please try my other ones if this one 'agreed' with you!
